content:
• Thursday, April 11, 2013
  • XXIA

    Ixia (NASDAQ:XXIA) cuts its Q1 revenue view after restated prior results. It lowers its top-line...

    Ixia (NASDAQ:XXIA) cuts its Q1 revenue view after restated prior results. It lowers its top-line guidance by $4M, now expecting revenue of $121M to $123M. The diminished outlook reflects the company's restating previous periods to recognize $4.15M in revenue related to an implied warranty arrangement with a customer. Shares -4.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:17 PM
  • ASH

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ASH +6%. NFLX +3%. TLAB +2%. PCYG +2%. HBI +2%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ASH +6%. NFLX +3%. TLAB +2%. PCYG +2%. HBI +2%.
    After-hours top losers: HRS -7%. SBY -3%. JBHT -3%. KRO -2%. CMRX -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM
  • WLT

    Walter Energy (NYSE:WLT) +6.7% AH after reporting improved Q1 performance vs. Q4 2012, driven by...

    Walter Energy (NYSE:WLT) +6.7% AH after reporting improved Q1 performance vs. Q4 2012, driven by increased metallurgical coal sales volume and price, increased production and lower costs. Says it is seeing stronger demand and improved pricing, with Q2 benchmark prices of $172/metric ton for hard coking coal and $141/metric ton for low vol PCI.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:15 PM | 3 Comments
  • NFLX

    That was quick: Shortly after Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) disclosed it may share company info via...

    That was quick: Shortly after Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) disclosed it may share company info via Facebook/Twitter, Reed Hastings has used his Facebook page to boast Netflix streamed 4B hours of video over the last 3 months. The July '12 Facebook post that (temporarily) got Hastings in hot water with the SEC bragged of 1B hours in the month of June. Shares +3.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM
  • HRS

    Harris (NYSE:HRS) -6.8% AH after warning it expects FQ3 (March quarter) revenue of $1.2B and EPS...

    Harris (NYSE:HRS) -6.8% AH after warning it expects FQ3 (March quarter) revenue of $1.2B and EPS of $1.12, below a consensus of $1.32B and $1.26. The company is also lowering its FY13 EPS guidance range to $4.60-$4.70 from $5-$5.20, and is now forecasting a 6%-7% Y/Y revenue drop for the year - the consensus is for EPS of $5.03 and a 3.5% drop. Harris primarily blames soft tactical radio orders, due to U.S. government budget uncertainty and the "increased likelihood" international orders will be pushed out into early FY14. GD -0.8%. CSC -0.7%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM
  • ASH

    Ashland (NYSE:ASH) +4.1% AH after Jana Partners discloses a 7.4% active stake; the hedge fund...

    Ashland (NYSE:ASH) +4.1% AH after Jana Partners discloses a 7.4% active stake; the hedge fund has engaged in discussions with ASH management, and believes shares are "undervalued and represent an attractive investment opportunity."

     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • JBHT

    More on J.B. Hunt Transport (NASDAQ:JBHT): Q1 comes in line on revenue but misses on a per share...

    More on J.B. Hunt Transport (NASDAQ:JBHT): Q1 comes in line on revenue but misses on a per share basis. Net earnings rose 8.4% as the trucking company reported stronger revenue and volume in most of its business segments. The intermodal division, by far the largest contributor to the top line, reported revenue improved 15% to $796.3M amid volume growth of 13%, as well as improved revenue per load. Its trucking segment saw the only revenue decline, down by 21%, mostly owing to proportionate reduction in the size of its fleet. Shares -3.7%

     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • BB

    Z10 returns are in-line with those of other high-end smartphones, BlackBerry (BBRY -7.8%)...

    Z10 returns are in-line with those of other high-end smartphones, BlackBerry (BBRY -7.8%) insists, addressing a report that returns were now exceeding sales at some top retailers. Meanwhile, Pac Crest's James Faucette, who has been bearish on BlackBerry for some time, estimates today the weekly sell-through rates for the Z10 at U.S. carriers are only around 60K units. He forecasts just 2.9M BB10 shipments for the May quarter, with half that total consisting of channel fill.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 34 Comments
  • BSX

    Shares of Boston Scientific (BSX -1.5%) tanked into the close of trading today, with no...

    Shares of Boston Scientific (BSX -1.5%) tanked into the close of trading today, with no significant news hitting the tape.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • MGT

    MGT Capital Investments (MGT +11.8%) adds to gains posted over the past week as SA contributor...

    MGT Capital Investments (MGT +11.8%) adds to gains posted over the past week as SA contributor John Ford speculates about a possible settlement related to pending patent litigation. For its part, the company said Tuesday it is not aware of "any material undisclosed developments that would account for the recent increase in the price and volume of its common stock."

     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • JBHT

    J. B. Hunt Transport Services (NASDAQ:JBHT): Q1 EPS of $0.61. Revenue of $1.29B. Shares -3% AH. (PR)

    J. B. Hunt Transport Services (NASDAQ:JBHT): Q1 EPS of $0.61. Revenue of $1.29B. Shares -3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • MSFT

    No mercy has been shown to Microsoft (MSFT -4.3%) today in the wake of IDC's figures (blamed in...

    No mercy has been shown to Microsoft (MSFT -4.3%) today in the wake of IDC's figures (blamed in part on Win. 8) and Goldman's downgrade. Goldman now sees the PC/tablet sales ratio falling to 59/41 in 2014, and thinks Microsoft could respond with price cuts or SG&A spending cuts. Nomura's Rick Sherlund wonders if a breakup or privatization is possible for Microsoft. He notes March was better than Jan. or Feb. for PC sales, but is still downbeat. "It really takes your breath away, just how bad the quarter was." Separately, Argus has downgraded Intel (INTC -2%) to Hold.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM | 26 Comments
  • MPAC-OLD

    Mod-Pac (MPAC-OLD +10%) trades up after agreeing to a raised all-cash takeover offer from its...

    Mod-Pac (MPAC-OLD +10%) trades up after agreeing to a raised all-cash takeover offer from its CEO and chairman that values the carton-packaging company at about $28M. CEO Daniel G. Keane, Chairman Kevin T. Keane and their affiliates will give holders $8.40 a share, a 12% premium to Wednesday's closing price and a 53% premium to the closing price on October 26 , before their original acquisition proposal was made public. =

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • HL

    Deutsche Bank issues a host of upgrades and higher price targets for miners, chiding investors...

    Deutsche Bank issues a host of upgrades and higher price targets for miners, chiding investors for heading for the hills instead of waiting for expected management-driven turnarounds, asset sales and restructurings. Hecla Mining (HL +2.2%) is raised to Hold from Sell with a $4.60 target (up from $4); targets also are lifted on ABX, CDE, KGC, TC, VALE, CLF, GG, NEM, TCK, SSRI.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 5 Comments
  • FBIO

    Coronado Biosciences (CNDO +10.6%) moves up after raising $9.9M and $7.6M (after expenses) in...

    Coronado Biosciences (CNDO +10.6%) moves up after raising $9.9M and $7.6M (after expenses) in at-the-market offerings managed by MLV & Co. The company says it will either fund R&D or will invest the proceeds in short-term marketable securities. Prior to the offering, the company had raised $10.5M YTD under the ATM program. (See earnings transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • CHFS

    Shares of Sunshine Heart (SSH -11.3%) slide today after pricing its offer of 2.5M shares at...

    Shares of Sunshine Heart (SSH -11.3%) slide today after pricing its offer of 2.5M shares at $5.25 per share, a 13% discount to Wednesday's close. The medical-device maker plans to use the proceeds for clinical trials and product development, as well as other general purposes. The company has a current float of around 9.5M shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • PSX

    Phillips 66 (PSX -2.9%) shares slump as it reports an emission at its Rodeo refinery in...

    Phillips 66 (PSX -2.9%) shares slump as it reports an emission at its Rodeo refinery in California related to an unplanned unit shutdown. It's part of a broad slump in refiners today, picking up pessimism in the sector which has led to sharp recent losses: VLO -4.8% (despite a plug by Jim Cramer), HFC -4.4%, TSO -3.3%, MPC -3.2%, WNR -2.9%, CVI -2.4%, ALJ -2.3%, NTI -2.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM | 4 Comments
  • NTIC

    Shares of Northern Technologies International (NTIC -16.6%) gets slammed today after its Q2 EPS...

    Shares of Northern Technologies International (NTIC -16.6%) gets slammed today after its Q2 EPS comes in shy of Street estimates, despite a 5.5% increase in net sales. The company blames the miss on higher tax expenses and an increase in startup costs as the company ramps up production on a broad range of new products. Net income was $0.10 per share, compared to $0.14 in the the comparable year-ago quarter. Analysts were expecting $0.16 per share. Net sales increased 5.5% over the same period.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • TSLA

    Tesla Motors (TSLA +5.5%) wins a court battle in New York when a judge dismisses a case against...

    Tesla Motors (TSLA +5.5%) wins a court battle in New York when a judge dismisses a case against the automaker trying to prevent it from selling directly to consumers.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM | 6 Comments
  • HLF

    Herbalife (HLF +3.8%) pops on reports from CNBC that the criminal complaint filed against the...

    Herbalife (HLF +3.8%) pops on reports from CNBC that the criminal complaint filed against the charged former KPMG auditor Scott London inferred the company was going to go private. However, the SEC complaint doesn't appears to discuss a takeover of HLF, but instead refers to London passing information to Shaw on mergers involving RSC Holdings and United Rentals, and Pacific Capital with Union Bank.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • BMC

    BMC Software (BMC +1.7%) spikes higher after Reuters reports two P-E consortiums are finalizing...

    BMC Software (BMC +1.7%) spikes higher after Reuters reports two P-E consortiums are finalizing bids set to be made on April 22. One consortium features Thoma Bravo, KKR, and TPG, and the other Bain Capital and Golden Gate Capital. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • BIOL

    Biolase (BIOL +13.3%) posts outsized gains after the FDA approves its EPIC 10S" soft tissue...

    Biolase (BIOL +13.3%) posts outsized gains after the FDA approves its EPIC 10S" soft tissue diode laser for surgical use in "over 80 different indications in 19 medical markets." CEO Federico Pignatelli says the clearance gives the company "the ability to leverage [the instrument] across a wide range of multi-billion dollar medical markets." SA contributor Craig Keolanui called the stock a "rising star" late last month.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM

  • Healthcare and biotech ETFs continue to churn higher again today, hitting new 52-week highs...

    Healthcare and biotech ETFs continue to churn higher again today, hitting new 52-week highs across the board: Health Care SPDR (XLV +1%), Vanguard Health Care ETF (VHT +0.9%), iShares Dow Jones US Healthcare (IYH +0.9%),. Biotech ETF iShares NASDAQ Biotechnology Index (IBB +1.3%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • CREX

    Wireless Ronin Technologies (RNIN +31.6%) jumps after announcing a partnership with Delphi...

    Wireless Ronin Technologies (RNIN +31.6%) jumps after announcing a partnership with Delphi Display Systems under which Delphi is licensed to use RNIN's HTML5-based software for the marketing of "customer engagement solutions to quick-service restaurants and pump topper gas station markets." RNIN will receive $2M over five years with $750K due to the company within 48 hours of execution, and will get "recurring hosting and maintenance revenue" from the deal as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN +6.6%) rallies after Gene Munster argues the company could deliver a Q1 daily...

    Groupon (GRPN +6.6%) rallies after Gene Munster argues the company could deliver a Q1 daily deals take rate of 33%, something the Piper analyst believes would translate into revenue of $607M (above a $590.2M consensus). Munster was also bullish on Groupon going into its not-too-well-received Q4 report.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM
  • MDT

    Medtronic (MDT +1.3%) moves up today after saying it's initiated enrollment of the first patient...

    Medtronic (MDT +1.3%) moves up today after saying it's initiated enrollment of the first patient in its SubQStim II clinical trial which uses peripheral nerve stimulation, also known as subcutaneous nerve stimulation, to reduce chronic, intractable post-surgical back pain.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • TI

    Telecom Italia (TI +5.9%) jumps as hopes of an Italian mobile merger with Hutchinson Whampoa...

    Telecom Italia (TI +5.9%) jumps as hopes of an Italian mobile merger with Hutchinson Whampoa grow. A Telecom Italia board meeting to discuss a possible merger took place today, and Hutchinson has stated it's willing to support a deal if it can obtain the largest stake in TI. That would mean a bigger stake than the 22.4% jointly held by Telefonica (TEF +0.4%) and three Italian banks. Hutchinson has reportedly been eying a ~30% stake, and Telefonica is reportedly willing to unload its position in TI. Regulatory and/or political opposition could still scuttle a deal.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • CMG

    Shares of Chipotle (CMG -2.2%) move lower after Jeffrey Gundlach calls the restaurant operator a...

    Shares of Chipotle (CMG -2.2%) move lower after Jeffrey Gundlach calls the restaurant operator a "good short" idea and ITG Majestic says March sales are running below consensus.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM
  • SGYP

    Synergy Pharmaceuticals (SGYP -11%) takes a big hit after pricing its public offering of 16.375M...

    Synergy Pharmaceuticals (SGYP -11%) takes a big hit after pricing its public offering of 16.375M shares at $5.46, an 8.5% discount to yesterday's close. The sale generated round $90.1M in gross proceeds.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM
  • ACAD

    Midday top 10 gainers: ACAD +55%. RNIN +26%. RAD +18%. ZUMZ +15%. MEA +13%. BIOL +12%. MGT +12%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: ACAD +55%. RNIN +26%. RAD +18%. ZUMZ +15%. MEA +13%. BIOL +12%. MGT +12%. PBTH +12%. MPAC-OLD +11%. TVL +11%.
    Midday top 10 losers: LEDS -17%. FTNT -14%. OTC:ROYL -14%. NTIC -16%. HXM -11%. CREG -11%. PRMW -10%. GNVC -10%. SGYP -10%. OCZ -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • ING

    ING Group (ING +1.1%) which is divesting its U.S. business in an upcoming IPO, says it will...

    ING Group (ING +1.1%) which is divesting its U.S. business in an upcoming IPO, says it will change the name of ING US to to Voya Financial. The rebranding is expected to take 24 months following the IPO, and until that time, the company will continue to operate as ING US. The firm says it's choice of the name Voya Financial is a play on the term "guiding investors through their financial voyage."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 6 Comments
  • MDT

    Covidien (COV +1.1%) says it's entered into an agreement with VIDA Diagnostics to distribute...

    Covidien (COV +1.1%) says it's entered into an agreement with VIDA Diagnostics to distribute it's Apollo pulmonary imaging software services. The agreement enables COV to offer a combination of technologies from VIDA and Covidien's i-Logic lung navigation system, which provides physicians with enhanced detail for the minimally invasive diagnosis and treatment planning of a variety of lung diseases.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • OCSL

    Fifth Street Finance (FSC -3.5%) trades lower after pricing a public offering of 13.5M shares at...

    Fifth Street Finance (FSC -3.5%) trades lower after pricing a public offering of 13.5M shares at a discount to Wednesday's close. The company will use the proceeds to repay debt but notes it will likely "re-borrow under its credit facilities to make investments." SA Pro contributor Daniel Moore warns that FSC may be reaching for yield causing the quality of its credit portfolio to decline and says "there is no visible sustainable rationale" for the shares to trade at a premium to NAV.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • TM

    Automobile stocks (CARZ, VROM) hit a higher gear with a positive report on sales in China and...

    Automobile stocks (CARZ, VROM) hit a higher gear with a positive report on sales in China and ongoing enthusiasm over sales stateside helping to tip sentiment. Advancers: Toyota (NYSE:TM) +3.6%, General Motors (NYSE:GM) +3.1%, Honda (NYSE:HMC) +2.7%, Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA) +3.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • AFFY

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY +0.9%) rebounds from early morning weakness after the company disclosed in a...

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY +0.9%) rebounds from early morning weakness after the company disclosed in a regulatory filing that it has entered into a fourth amendment to its collaboration and license agreements with Takeda Pharmaceutical. The amendment, which is a part of the company's ongoing restructuring efforts, changes the economics from a profit-sharing arrangement to a milestone and royalty-based compensation structure, and stems from the voluntary recall and FDA suspension related to Omontys.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • CAL

    Brown Shoe Company (BWS +5.7%) gets a nice bump as Brean Capital initiates with a Buy. It's a...

    Brown Shoe Company (BWS +5.7%) gets a nice bump as Brean Capital initiates with a Buy. It's a "compelling turnaround story," says analyst Danielle McCoy. On its latest call, the company's CEO Diane Sullivan noted that BWS has "followed through and delivered on strategic initiatives [and is now] a slightly smaller but leaner and more profitable company."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • TIF

    Topeka Capital gives retailers a boost upgrading Tiffany (TIF +2.5%) to Buy and initiating Gap...

    Topeka Capital gives retailers a boost upgrading Tiffany (TIF +2.5%) to Buy and initiating Gap (GPS +1.9%), and Zumiez (ZUMZ +15.7%) at Buy. TIF's "earnings are poised for recovery", GPS has "returned to consistent sales growth," and ZUMZ is "one of the few retailers with growth in its core domestic business [and an] international expansion strategy." (Earlier: ZUMZ rips higher on strong sales) 
     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • APPCQ

    American Apparel (APP +5.5%) pops after saying comps rose 8% Y/Y in March as sales came in at...

    American Apparel (APP +5.5%) pops after saying comps rose 8% Y/Y in March as sales came in at $50.3M, up 2% from last year. The company also notes preliminary results show a 5% sales increase for the quarter and an 8% increase in same store sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM
  • RTI

    Good news and (perceived) bad news from RTI International Metals (RTI -5%): the company raises...

    Good news and (perceived) bad news from RTI International Metals (RTI -5%): the company raises Q1 guidance for operating income to between $14-16M on a $4M import duty recovery, but investors don't seem to like the announcement of a $250M offering of convertible debt due 2019.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • MEG

    Shares of Lin TV (TVL +10.8%) are up big again in the wake of the company's deal to buy a...

    Shares of Lin TV (TVL +10.8%) are up big again in the wake of the company's deal to buy a majority stake in Dedicated Media. The recent string of aggressive moves by the media concern seem to be drawing the interest investors and analysts with it presenting a unique combination of old-school TV stations and digital media moxy.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • UTHR

    United Therapeutics (UTHR +0.1%) says it's received approval to perform a human Phase I study in...

    United Therapeutics (UTHR +0.1%) says it's received approval to perform a human Phase I study in Australia using Pluristem Therapeutics' (PSTI +1.6%) PLacental eXpanded cells in patients diagnosed with Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension. United Therapeutics and Pluristem entered into a licensing agreement in 2011 that allows UTHR to develop, market and sell PSTI's PLX-PAD cells.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • PBTH

    Prolor Biotech (PBTH +8.2%) hires Jefferies Group to evaluate strategic alternatives. An unnamed...

    Prolor Biotech (PBTH +8.2%) hires Jefferies Group to evaluate strategic alternatives. An unnamed source says the company has drawn interest from big pharma over the past 12 months, but notes PBTH has not decided to sell itself. SA contributor Daniel Lauchheimer's article suggesting the stock has "unlimited upside" looks prescient. (See also: PBTH gets orphan drug designation)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • IART

    Integra Lifesciences (IART -8%) take a hit this morning after announcing late yesterday that it...

    Integra Lifesciences (IART -8%) take a hit this morning after announcing late yesterday that it had issued a voluntary recall of certaing products manufactured in its Anasco, Puerto Rico facility. The company expects the recall to affect its revenues and profits for both Q1 and Q2. It now anticipates its Q1 EPS to come in around $0.30 - $0.40 on revenues in the range of $194M - $197M, versus Street expectations for $0.70 on $204M. For Q2, the company sees revenues of $205M - $211M, versus the $219.52M analysts are expecting.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • YUM

    China reports five new cases of the H7N9 avian flu including a death in Shanghai. What to watch:...

    China reports five new cases of the H7N9 avian flu including a death in Shanghai. What to watch: Keep an eye on Yum Brands (YUM +0.5%). Though the restaurant operator has already reported on the negative impact of the bird flu on March sales, many of the most alarming headlines have been April events. In addition, the buzz from Weibo is that some Chinese consumers are debating giving up chicken on safety concerns.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM | 2 Comments
  • MJNA

    Medical Marijuana (OTCPK:MJNA +17.2%) rallies after reporting Q1 gross revenue of $8.45M (+66%...

    Medical Marijuana (OTCPK:MJNA +17.2%) rallies after reporting Q1 gross revenue of $8.45M (+66% Q/Q and +377% Y/Y) and net income of $5.52M. The company adds it plans to deliver a 24-month audit history of its financials by the end of Q2, and asserts it has "positioned itself to become fully reporting" with the SEC once the audit history is complete. MJNA plans to reports its audited Q1 financials by May 15. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM | 10 Comments
  • ZUMZ

    Shares of Zumiez (ZUMZ +14.7%) rip higher after reporting strong sales for March. Though the...

    Shares of Zumiez (ZUMZ +14.7%) rip higher after reporting strong sales for March. Though the retailer is bumping up against a period of soft comparable sales numbers, management also deserves credit for positioning the company strategically in the sport-related apparel sector.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • PCYC

    Pharmacyclics (PCYC +1.7%) gets a bump higher this morning after announcing its Phase III...

    Pharmacyclics (PCYC +1.7%) gets a bump higher this morning after announcing its Phase III clinical trial using Ibrutinib versus Chlorambucil to treat chronic lymphocytic leukemia and small lymphocyctic lymphoma has enrolled its fifth patient. The enrollment subsequently triggers a fourth $50M milestone payment obligation from JNJ's Janssen Biotech, who is collaborating with PCYC on Ibrutinib in oncology. On Monday, the drug was granted a 3rd "Breakthrough Therapy Designation" by the FDA.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM | 1 Comment
  • LRCX

    An upgrade to Outperform from Cowen puts Lam Research (LRCX +3%) within striking distance of its...

    An upgrade to Outperform from Cowen puts Lam Research (LRCX +3%) within striking distance of its 52-week high. Some other chip equipment makers are also outperforming a bit, as investors continue to bet the industry will benefit from an arms race between Intel, TSMC, and Samsung. ASML +1.5%. CYMI +1.2%. KLAC +1.1%. MTSN +3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • BB

    Several U.S. retailers have seen a pickup in Z10 returns, says Detwiler Fenton in a note that...

    Several U.S. retailers have seen a pickup in Z10 returns, says Detwiler Fenton in a note that could be pressuring BlackBerry (BBRY -5.2%). Detwiler, which also issued a downbeat note on Z10 demand last month, adds the pace of returns in some cases is exceeding the pace of sales, and that users are complaining about the Z10's UI, Maps app, and app availability. Separately, Amazon has cut its subsidized Z10 price to $99. (AT&T launch)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM | 47 Comments
  • MTD

    Goldman upgrades the Life Sciences Tools & Diagnostics sector to Attractive, but some...

    Goldman upgrades the Life Sciences Tools & Diagnostics sector to Attractive, but some individual names suffered as Mettler Toledo (MTD -2%) and Sigma-Aldrich (SIAL -1.1%) catch downgrades to Neutral from Buy. SIAL has "few levers to drive EBIT [as] long-term organic growth guidance of 4-6% is too high." Quest Diagnostics (DGX +3.5%) and LabCorp (LH +2%) are upgraded to Buy and Neutral respectively on the former's "untapped capital allocation potential and margin expansion" and the latter's ability to manage pricing pressure.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • NFLX

    Goldman's Heath Terry has raised hit PT on Netflix (NFLX +2.9%) to $184 from $125, albeit while...

    Goldman's Heath Terry has raised hit PT on Netflix (NFLX +2.9%) to $184 from $125, albeit while reiterating a Neutral. "We believe the addressable market of subscribers is better defined by the number of "connected consumers" than households," says Terry, who thinks Netflix's domestic streaming sub base will grow to 53M in 5 years from a current 22.8M. He's lowering his 2013 EPS estimate, but significantly raising his 2014 and 2015 estimates. Yesterday, Evercore launched coverage with an Underperform. (Pac Crest)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM | 1 Comment
  • SBGI

    Sinclair Broadcast Group (SBGI +6.9%) acquires Fisher Communications (FSCI +0.9%) in a $373.3M...

    Sinclair Broadcast Group (SBGI +6.9%) acquires Fisher Communications (FSCI +0.9%) in a $373.3M deal. Apparently Sinclair wasn't joking when it said in February its previous acquisitions had "put very little stress at all" on its ability to make additional acquisitions. FSCI shareholders will get $41 in cash for their shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM | 1 Comment
  • RAD

    Shares of Rite Aid (RAD +11.2%) pop after the drug store operator beats profit estimates handily...

    Shares of Rite Aid (RAD +11.2%) pop after the drug store operator beats profit estimates handily with its FQ4 report. The company is starting to benefit by the restructuring of parts of its stores into wellness centers with expanded health services.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM
  • MBOT

    StemCells (STEM) jumps 11.2% after saying that it's entered into an agreement to receive a...

    StemCells (STEM) jumps 11.2% after saying that it's entered into an agreement to receive a "forgivable loan" of $19.3M from the California Institute for Regenerative Medicine to help finance the development of the company's HuCNS-SC treatment for Alzheimer's Disease and fund FDA filings.
